title: Ryan Pettinella
text:
Ryan Pettinella (born July 12, 1984) is a retired American-Italian professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player. He stands 6'9" tall, weighs 245 lbs, and played as a <a href="forward-center">forward-center</a>. He played in the <a href="Lega%20Basket%20Serie%20A">Italian Lega Basket Serie A</a> with <a href="Premiata%20Montegranaro">Premiata Montegranaro</a> and was a two-time <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild%20karla%20%28basketball%29">national champion</a> with Icelandic club <a href="Grindav%C3%ADk%20%28basketball%20club%29">UMF Grindavík</a>.
High school.
Pettinella graduated in 2003 from <a href="McQuaid%20Jesuit%20High%20School">McQuaid Jesuit High School</a>. He earned New York All-State selections for basketball in both his junior and senior year. During his senior season Pettinella led McQuaid Jesuit to the New York Class A State Championship, a 27-1 record, and a third ranking nationally in the <a href="USAToday">USAToday</a> poll.
College.
Upon graduation, Pettinella enrolled at <a href="The%20Wharton%20School">The Wharton School</a>, <a href="University%20of%20Pennsylvania">University of Pennsylvania</a> where he played two years for head coach <a href="Fran%20Dunphy">Fran Dunphy</a> before transferring to the <a href="University%20of%20Virginia">University of Virginia</a>. At <a href="University%20of%20Pennsylvania">Penn</a> he helped lead the Quakers to an <a href="Ivy%20League">Ivy League</a> Championship in 2005. The following year Pettinella transferred to <a href="University%20of%20Virginia">Virginia</a> where he played his final two seasons with the <a href="Virginia%20Cavaliers">Cavaliers</a>. In 2007 the Cavaliers won the <a href="Atlantic%20Coast%20Conference">ACC</a> Regular Season Championship. Pettinella achieved a degree in <a href="political%20science">political science</a> and <a href="foreign%20affairs">foreign affairs</a>.
Professional career.
After graduating from Virginia in 2008, Pettinella signed with <a href="Premiata%20Montegranaro">Premiata Montegranaro</a> of the <a href="Lega%20Basket%20Serie%20A">Italian Lega Basket Serie A</a>. The following season, Ryan played in Spain for <a href="Ciudad%20de%20Vigo%20B%C3%A1squet">Ciudad de Vigo Básquet</a>.
In 2010 Pettinella signed with <a href="Grindav%C3%ADk%20%28basketball%20club%29">UMFG Grindavík</a> of the Icelandic <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild%20karla%20%28basketball%29">Úrvalsdeild karla</a>. He continued the following two seasons with Grindavik winning back to back national championships.
In August 2013, Pettinella returned to Italy joining <a href="Basket%20Recanati">Basket Recanati</a> of the <a href="Serie%20A2%20Basket">Italian Serie A2 Basket</a>.
